alert.note: Alert for Assumption; Lower Terrebonne; Upper Lafourche; Upper Terrebonne (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 05 at 6:27AM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Terrebonne, northwestern Lafourche and southeastern Assumption Parishes through 700 AM CDT... At 625 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a waterspout over coastal waters and marshy areas 13 miles south of Bayou Vista, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Waterspouts, wind gusts up to 50 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Waterspouts can easily overturn boats and create locally hazardous waters. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Houma, Thibodaux, Schriever, Gray, Raceland, Bayou Cane and Dulac. WATERSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Assumption; Lower Terrebonne; Upper Lafourche; Upper Terrebonne
